page.title: 06A local pig farm
page.content: There is a{pig farm}in the Chilcompton area. It has twenty one boars and four hundred and fify sows. The farmer said, sows normally gave two or three litters a year. This produces approximately ten thousand pigs. They have three{different breeds}at the farm, the Land Race, the Welsh and the Large White.We saw newly born piglets drinking their mother's milk.The farmer told us that after four or five days they eat proper food, which is small pellets made from cereal and other dried food.The farmer said, that each morning the piglets were checked to see that they were alright.He also told us meningitis and pneumonia were {common diseases}among pigs.When a pig is twenty five weeks old it is sold to a farm in Devon for Â£75.00 to be fattened up for the market.
